title: Sell Aged Suntory Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Suntory Royal, Crest, & Reserve | Aged Japanese Whisky | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your back-vintage Suntory whisky. We buy Suntory Royal 12/15, Crest 12, Special Reserve, and older limited blends.
heroSubhead: Buying Suntory Royal, Crest 12, and Special Reserve back-vintages.
introParagraph: Beyond Yamazaki and Hibiki, Suntory has a deep catalog of historic blends. We purchase 'dusty' bottles of Royal, Crest, and Reserve from the 80s and 90s.
photoChecklist: Front label showing age statement (if any)
Top of cap (tax strips on old bottles)
conditionFactors: Tax Strips: US Tax strips or Japanese tax seals date the bottle
Evaporation: Older screw caps on 'Royal' bottles can loosen, check fill
Labels: Foxing (brown spots) on old paper labels is common
Box: Original gift boxes add value
pricingFactors: Age Statement: Crest 12 is the leader here.
SR vs 12/15: 'SR' Royal is common; 12 and 15 year versions are rarer.
Decanters: Fancy ceramic shapes (Instruments, Animals) have specific collector value.
Era: Pre-1989 (tax reform) bottles are historically interesting.

faqs.question: Is Suntory Royal valuable?
faqs.answer: It was the premium standard in the 80s. While not priced like Yamazaki, vintage Royal has solid value.

faqs.question: Do you buy the animal bottles?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Zodiac ceramic series is collectible. We check for weight (fill level).

faqs.question: What is 'Suntory Crest'?
faqs.answer: Crest 12 was a premium blend positioned above Royal. It was discontinued and is now sought after.

faqs.question: Do you buy Suntory Old?
faqs.answer: Only older versions (70s/80s) or mostly in bulk lots.

faqs.question: What about 'The Whisky'?
faqs.answer: Yes, Suntory 'The Whisky' is a very high-end discontinued porcelain release. We buy it.

faqs.question: Is Toki worth selling?
faqs.answer: No, Toki is a current mixing whisky readily available for $30.
